wxString ExecuteCommand (  bool  isRemote,
wxString  cmd
) 
 

public ExecuteCommand This starts a command, and waits until it has come to completion. Extremely simple: if isRemote is true, it calls ExecuteRemoteCommand, otherwise, it calls ExecuteLocalCommand.

Parameters:
isRemote bool Whether this is to be executed remotely.
cmd wxString What command to execute.
Returns:
wxString The resulting output

NetworkStatus GetStatus (   ) 
 

public GetStatus NET_STARTING = NEVER used externally NET_GOOD = good to go! NET_UNKNOWN_HOST = host finger print not in cache NET_CONN_REFUSED = host wouldn't allow a connection NET_AUTH_FAILED = user+pass did not work on host NET_ERROR_MESSAGE = default/catch-all For more information, also check GetStatusDetails

Returns:
NetworkStatus status
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-22-2004

public GetStatusDetails NET_STARTING = nothing NET_GOOD = nothing NET_UNKNOWN_HOST = host finger print NET_CONN_REFUSED = stderr message NET_AUTH_FAILED = stderr message NET_ERROR_MESSAGE = message

bool MaintainSettings (   )  [private]
 

private MaintainSettings Not meant to update my status -- just my settings (if necessary) This returns true if any settings have changed. I need to do this polling because Options is passive (it doesn't tell me when it's changed).

Returns:
bool Returns true if anything has changed in Options.

private ParseFindOutput This parsing can easily be broken! But, I am pretty confident in the integrity of the string I'm parsing, because I know what's coming in. This does both files and directories because they are structured/listed the same.

bool SCPDoTransfer (  wxString  from_path_name,
wxString  to_path_name
)  [private]
 

private SCPDoTransfer To simplify the transfer of files, I'm just using pscp to transfer the file It would be nice, for consistency and speed, if I could just pipe into a file. It might even behoove us to re-write this to use: "output = ExecuteLocalCommand(cmd);" This ONLY DOES local -> remote transfers. For speed reasons (needing to authenticate everytime) this is not the optimal solution.

Parameters:
from_path_name wxString Local Path and Filename
to_path_name wxString Remote Path and Filename
Returns:
bool Whether the call succeeded or not.
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:

void SSHCacheFingerprint (   ) 
 

public SSHCacheFingerprint Basically, this means that the PlinkConnect will not work until the fingerprint gets cached. To do so, I run my own, send a "y" to accept the cache then immediately kill the process. I am assuming!!! that the connection should work, and I'm just doing this to accept the cache.

Returns:
void
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-22-2004

bool SSHGetDirListing (  wxString  dirPath,
DirListing &  listing,
bool  includeHidden = false
)  [private]
 

private SSHGetDirListing Get the listing of the directory specified by doing a "find" on the remote server, and parsing the output (via parsefindoutput). It would be nice to use only "ls" instead of "find". But, instead of dealing with parsing(or regex'ing) an "ls -l" for what's a dir, and what isn't, I use "find". Try using "ls --color=never -Q --format=vertical -1 -A"

Parameters:
dirPath wxString What directory.
listing DirListing & return value
includeHidden bool [=false] Whether to include hidden files
Returns:
bool Whether the call succeeded or not.
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-22-2004

wxTextOutputStream * StartCommand (  bool  isRemote,
wxString  cmd,
wxEvtHandler *  owner
) 
 

public StartCommand This is for asynchronous interaction. Extremely simple: if isRemote is true, it calls StartRemoteCommand, otherwise, it calls StartLocalCommand.

Parameters:
isRemote bool Whether command should be run remotely or locally
cmd wxString The commandline to run
owner wxEvtHandler * The object to notify when stuff happens
Returns:
wxTextOutputStream * The new process's stream, so the owner can send stuff to the process
